members.name: getData
members.comment: Gets the metadata for this block

return: block specific metadata

members.name: getBlockData
members.comment: Gets the complete block data for this block

return: block specific data

members.name: getRelative
members.comment: Gets the block at the given offsets

param: modX - X-coordinate offset
modY - Y-coordinate offset
modZ - Z-coordinate offset
return: Block at the given offsets

members.name: getRelative
members.comment: Gets the block at the given face This method is equal to getRelative(face, 1)

param: face - Face of this block to return
return: Block at the given face

members.name: getRelative

param: face - Face of this block to return
distance - Distance to get the block at
return: Block at the given face

members.name: getType
members.comment: Gets the type of this block

return: block type

members.name: getLightLevel
members.comment: Gets the light level between 0-15

return: light level

members.name: getLightFromSky
members.comment: Get the amount of light at this block from the sky. Any light given from other sources (such as blocks like torches) will be ignored.

return: Sky light level

members.name: getLightFromBlocks
members.comment: Get the amount of light at this block from nearby blocks. Any light given from other sources (such as the sun) will be ignored.

return: Block light level

members.name: getWorld
members.comment: Gets the world which contains this Block

return: World containing this block

members.name: getX
members.comment: Gets the x-coordinate of this block

return: x-coordinate

members.name: getY
members.comment: Gets the y-coordinate of this block

return: y-coordinate

members.name: getZ
members.comment: Gets the z-coordinate of this block

return: z-coordinate

members.name: getBlockKey
members.comment: Returns this block's coordinates packed into a long value. Computed via: Block.getBlockKey(this.getX(), this.getY(), this.getZ())

return: This block's x, y, and z coordinates packed into a long value

members.name: getBlockKey
members.comment: Returns the specified block coordinates packed into a long value The return value can be computed as follows: long value = ((long)x & 0x7FFFFFF) | (((long)z & 0x7FFFFFF) << 27) | ((long)y << 54); And may be unpacked as follows: int x = (int) ((packed << 37) >> 37); int y = (int) (packed >>> 54); int z = (int) ((packed << 10) >> 37);

return: This block's x, y, and z coordinates packed into a long value

members.name: getBlockKeyX
members.comment: Returns the x component from the packed value.

param: packed - The packed value, as computed by getBlockKey(int, int, int)
return: The x component from the packed value.

members.name: getBlockKeyY
members.comment: Returns the y component from the packed value.

param: packed - The packed value, as computed by getBlockKey(int, int, int)
return: The y component from the packed value.

members.name: getBlockKeyZ
members.comment: Returns the z component from the packed value.

param: packed - The packed value, as computed by getBlockKey(int, int, int)
return: The z component from the packed value.

members.name: isValidTool
members.comment: Checks if the itemstack is a valid tool to break the block with

param: itemStack - The (tool) itemstack
return: whether the block will drop items

members.name: getLocation
members.comment: Gets the Location of the block

return: Location of block

members.name: getLocation
members.comment: Stores the location of the block in the provided Location object. If the provided Location is null this method does nothing and returns null.

param: loc - the location to copy into
return: The Location object provided or null

members.name: getChunk
members.comment: Gets the chunk which contains this block

return: Containing Chunk

members.name: setBlockData
members.comment: Sets the complete data for this block

param: data - new block specific data

members.name: setBlockData
members.comment: Sets the complete data for this block Note that applyPhysics = false is not in general safe. It should only be used when you need to avoid triggering a physics update of neighboring blocks, for example when creating a Bisected block. If you are using a custom populator, then this parameter may also be required to prevent triggering infinite chunk loads on border blocks. This method should NOT be used to "hack" physics by placing blocks in impossible locations. Such blocks are liable to be removed on various events such as world upgrades. Furthermore setting large amounts of such blocks in close proximity may overload the server physics engine if an update is triggered at a later point. If this occurs, the resulting behavior is undefined.

param: data - new block specific data
applyPhysics - false to cancel physics from the changed block

members.name: setType
members.comment: Sets the type of this block

param: type - Material to change this block to

members.name: setType
members.comment: Sets the type of this block Note that applyPhysics = false is not in general safe. It should only be used when you need to avoid triggering a physics update of neighboring blocks, for example when creating a Bisected block. If you are using a custom populator, then this parameter may also be required to prevent triggering infinite chunk loads on border blocks. This method should NOT be used to "hack" physics by placing blocks in impossible locations. Such blocks are liable to be removed on various events such as world upgrades. Furthermore setting large amounts of such blocks in close proximity may overload the server physics engine if an update is triggered at a later point. If this occurs, the resulting behavior is undefined.

param: type - Material to change this block to
applyPhysics - False to cancel physics on the changed block.

members.name: getFace

param: block - Block to compare against this block
return: BlockFace of this block which has the requested block, or null

members.name: getState
members.comment: Captures the current state of this block. You may then cast that state into any accepted type, such as Furnace or Sign. The returned object will never be updated, and you are not guaranteed that (for example) a sign is still a sign after you capture its state.

return: BlockState with the current state of this block.

see: optionally disables use of snapshot, to operate on real block data
param: useSnapshot - if this block is a TE, should we create a fully copy of the TileEntity
return: BlockState with the current state of this block

members.name: getBiome
members.comment: Returns the biome that this block resides in

return: Biome type containing this block

members.name: setBiome
members.comment: Sets the biome that this block resides in

param: bio - new Biome type for this block

members.name: isBlockPowered
members.comment: Returns true if the block is being powered by Redstone.

return: True if the block is powered.

members.name: isBlockIndirectlyPowered
members.comment: Returns true if the block is being indirectly powered by Redstone.

return: True if the block is indirectly powered.

members.name: isBlockFacePowered
members.comment: Returns true if the block face is being powered by Redstone.

param: face - The block face
return: True if the block face is powered.

members.name: isBlockFaceIndirectlyPowered
members.comment: Returns true if the block face is being indirectly powered by Redstone.

param: face - The block face
return: True if the block face is indirectly powered.

members.name: getBlockPower
members.comment: Returns the redstone power being provided to this block face

param: face - the face of the block to query or BlockFace.SELF for the block itself
return: The power level.

members.name: getBlockPower
members.comment: Returns the redstone power being provided to this block

return: The power level.

members.name: isEmpty
members.comment: Checks if this block is empty. A block is considered empty when getType() returns Material.AIR.

return: true if this block is empty

members.name: isLiquid
members.comment: Checks if this block is liquid. A block is considered liquid when getType() returns Material.WATER or Material.LAVA.

return: true if this block is liquid

members.name: isBuildable
members.comment: Check if this block is solid Determined by Minecraft, typically a block a player can use to place a new block to build things. An example of a non buildable block would be liquids, flowers, or fire

return: true if block is buildable

members.name: isBurnable
members.comment: Check if this block is burnable Determined by Minecraft, typically a block that fire can destroy (Wool, Wood)

return: true if block is burnable

members.name: isReplaceable
members.comment: Check if this block is replaceable Determined by Minecraft, representing a block that is not AIR that you can still place a new block at, such as flowers.

return: true if block is replaceable

members.name: isSolid
members.comment: Check if this block is solid Determined by Minecraft, typically a block a player can stand on and can't be passed through. This API is faster than accessing Material#isSolid as it avoids a material lookup and switch statement.

return: true if block is solid

members.name: getTemperature
members.comment: Gets the temperature of this block. If the raw biome temperature without adjusting for height effects is required then please use World.getTemperature(int, int).

return: Temperature of this block

members.name: getHumidity
members.comment: Gets the humidity of the biome of this block

return: Humidity of this block

members.name: getPistonMoveReaction
members.comment: Returns the reaction of the block when moved by a piston

return: reaction

members.name: breakNaturally
members.comment: Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had digged it regardless of the tool.

return: true if the block was destroyed

members.name: breakNaturally
members.comment: Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had digged it with a specific tool

param: tool - The tool or item in hand used for digging
return: true if the block was destroyed

members.name: breakNaturally
members.comment: Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had digged it with a specific tool

param: tool - The tool or item in hand used for digging
triggerEffect - Play the block break particle effect and sound
return: true if the block was destroyed

members.name: applyBoneMeal
members.comment: Simulate bone meal application to this block (if possible).

param: face - the face on which bonemeal should be applied
return: true if the block was bonemealed, false otherwise

members.name: getDrops
members.comment: Returns a list of items which would drop by destroying this block

return: a list of dropped items for this type of block

members.name: getDrops
members.comment: Returns a list of items which would drop by destroying this block with a specific tool

param: tool - The tool or item in hand used for digging
return: a list of dropped items for this type of block

members.name: getDrops
members.comment: Returns a list of items which would drop by the entity destroying this block with a specific tool

param: tool - The tool or item in hand used for digging
entity - the entity destroying the block
return: a list of dropped items for this type of block

members.name: isPreferredTool
members.comment: Returns if the given item is a preferred choice to break this Block. In some cases this determines if a block will drop anything or extra loot.

param: tool - The tool or item used for breaking this block
return: true if the tool is preferred for breaking this block.

members.name: getBreakSpeed
members.comment: Gets the speed at which the given player would break this block, taking into account tools, potion effects, whether or not the player is in water, enchantments, etc. The returned value is the amount of progress made in breaking the block. When the total breaking progress reaches 1.0f, the block is broken. Note that the break speed can change in the course of breaking a block, e.g. if a potion effect is applied or expires, or the player jumps/enters water.

param: player - player breaking the block
return: the speed at which the player breaks this block

members.name: isPassable
members.comment: Checks if this block is passable. A block is passable if it has no colliding parts that would prevent players from moving through it. Examples: Tall grass, flowers, signs, etc. are passable, but open doors, fence gates, trap doors, etc. are not because they still have parts that can be collided with.

return: true if passable

members.name: rayTrace
members.comment: Performs a ray trace that checks for collision with this specific block in its current state using its precise collision shape.

param: start - the start location
direction - the ray direction
maxDistance - the maximum distance
fluidCollisionMode - the fluid collision mode
return: the ray trace hit result, or null if there is no hit

members.name: getBoundingBox
members.comment: Gets the approximate bounding box for this block. This isn't exact as some blocks Stairs contain many bounding boxes to establish their complete form. Also, the box may not be exactly the same as the collision shape (such as cactus, which is 16/16 of a block with 15/16 collisional bounds). This method will return an empty bounding box if the geometric shape of the block is empty (such as air blocks).

return: the approximate bounding box of the block

members.name: getCollisionShape
members.comment: Gets the collision shape of this block.

return: a VoxelShape representing the collision shape of this block.

members.name: getSoundGroup
members.comment: Gets the BlockSoundGroup for this block. This object contains the block, step, place, hit, and fall sounds.

return: the sound group for this block

members.name: getTranslationKey
members.comment: Return the translation key for the Block, so the client can translate it into the active locale when using a TranslatableComponent.

return: the translation key

members.name: getDestroySpeed
members.comment: Gets the speed at which this block will be destroyed by a given ItemStack Default value is 1.0

param: itemStack - ItemStack used to mine this Block
return: the speed that this Block will be mined by the given ItemStack

members.name: getDestroySpeed
members.comment: Gets the speed at which this blook will be destroyed by a given ItemStack Default value is 1.0

param: itemStack - ItemStack used to mine this Block
considerEnchants - true to look at enchants on the itemstack
return: the speed that this Block will be mined by the given ItemStack
